children.name: Economy
children.info: The economy was a critical election issue; the recession led to high income inequality and an unimpressive recovery. Many blamed Obama's stimulus spending as ineffective, while others argued that he inherited the broken economy.

children.name: Jobs
children.info: The recession led to record-high unemployment rates, as well as differing opinions in how to deal with it, mainly between short-term stimulus packages and low government regulation.

children.name: Taxes
children.info: Obama planned to extend Bush-era tax cuts, allowing for higher taxes for high incomes. Romney supported a 20% reduction in taxes, as well as ending tax breaks for lower-income families.

children.name: Healthcare
children.info: Obamacare was a major topic of contention, with Obama supporting the Affordable Care Act and Medicaid, while Republicans opposed. Romney seeked to repeal the bill but maintain many of its provisions.

children.name: Corporations
children.info: Big businesses have been lobbying against nearly any Obama Administration-proposed reform, and questions were being raised about the role of corporate spending on the balance of power in Washington.

children.name: Drugs
children.info: Any change in rhetoric regarding the "War on Drugs" from the last election, did not solve the issue of drugs in relation to Latin America, with the need for international drug control.

children.name: Education
children.info: Obama supported the Pell grant and more forgiveness for student loans and government oversight, while Romney wanted to refocus the Pell grant and reduce regulation from the Department of Education.

children.name: War & Peace
children.info: The US successfully withdrew from Iraq, and had plans for removing troops from Afghanistan.. Obama gained favor for the raid on Bin Laden, but some voters believed that Romney would provide more forceful leadership.

children.name: LGBT Rights
children.info: Obama's views shifted from the 2008 election; he now expressed support for gay marriage, while marriage equality became an important issue on several state ballots.

children.name: Infrastructure & Technology
children.info: Obama's administration supported investing in infrastructure and launching assistive programs, while Romney's agenda involved spending less money on certain domestic programs.
